revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian |name =John Caparulo |image =John Caparulo.jpg |imagesize = |caption = |pseudonym = |birth_name = |birth_date ={{birth date and age|1975|9|22}} |birth_place =[[East Liverpool, Ohio]] |death_date = |death_place = |medium =[[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]]{{br}}[[Acting]] |nationality =[[United States of America|American]] |active =1997 – present |genre =[[Observational comedy|Observational]] |subject = |spouse = Jamie Caparulo |notable_work =''[[Wild West Comedy Show: 30 Days & 30 Nights - Hollywood to the Heartland|Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Tour]]''{{br}}''[[Chelsea Lately]]''{{br}}''[[Work It (TV series)|Work It]]''{{br}}''Mobile Home Disaster'' |signature = |website ={{url|http://www.johncaparulo.com}} |children =1 }} '''John Caparulo''' (born September 22, 1975) is an [[United States|American]] [[Stand-up comedy|stand-up]] [[comedian]]. He is perhaps best known for his appearances on the late night [[E!]] [[talk show]], ''[[Chelsea Lately]]''. ==Early life== Caparulo grew up in [[East Liverpool, Ohio]] and graduated from [[Kent State]] in 1998. Caparulo started his stand-up career in [[night club]]s in [[Cleveland, Ohio]] and [[Pittsburgh]] in 1997. He then spent several years working as a [[doorman (profession)|doorman]] at the [[The Comedy Store (California)|Comedy Store]] in [[Hollywood, Los Angeles, California|Hollywood, California]] and as a groundskeeper at a local [[golf]] course.{{cite news|last1=Gadino|first1=Dylan|title='Chelsea Lately' Put Comedian John Caparulo Center Stage, But Married Life Presents Far More Challenges|url=http://www.hollywoodtake.com/chelsea-lately-put-comedian-john-caparulo-center-stage-married-life-presents-far-more-challenges|accessdate=December 7, 2015|work=Hollywood Take|issue=September 28, 2013}}{{cite news|last1=McIntyre|first1=Michael K.|title=John Caparulo steps off your TV screen and on the Hilarities stage|url=http://www.cleveland.com/dining/index.ssf/2011/12/john_caparulo_steps_off_your_t.html|accessdate=December 7, 2015|work=Cleveland.com|date=December 7, 2011}}{{cite news|last1=McNulty|first1=Timothy|title=For Ohio comedian, tour was 'colossal'|url=http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/2008/02/08/For-Ohio-comedian-tour-was-colossal/stories/200802080150|accessdate=December 8, 2015|work=Pittsburgh Post-Gazette|date=February 8, 2008}} ==Career== John "Cap" Caparulo has a headlining residency at Harrah's in Las Vegas every Thursday, Friday, and Saturday. Caparulo first appeared at the 2003 ''[[Just for Laughs]]'' festival in [[Montreal]],{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G-8f_kqmwmU |title=John Caparulo - Just For Laughs 2006 |work=[[YouTube]].com |accessdate=March 17, 2009}} where he was offered a [[sitcom]],{{citation needed|date=December 2015}} and a spot on ''[[The Late Late Show (CBS TV series)|The Late Late Show with Craig Kilborn]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.tv.com/the-late-late-show-with-craig-kilborn/james-marsden-alex-kingston-and-john-caparulo/episode/1227951/summary.html |title=The Late Late Show with Crain Kilborn James Marsden, Alex Kingston, and John Caparulo |work=[[TV.com]] |accessdate=March 17, 2009}} He has since appeared on ''[[The Tonight Show]]'',{{cite web |url=http://www.hulu.com/watch/9816/john-caparulo |title=The Tonight Show: John Caparulo |work=[[Hulu]].com |accessdate=March 17, 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} was featured on ''[[Blue Collar Comedy Tour#The Next Generation|Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Next Generation]]'' hosted by [[Bill Engvall]],{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} and was one of the comedians documented on ''[[Wild West Comedy Show: 30 Days & 30 Nights - Hollywood to the Heartland|Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Tour]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117979963.html?categoryid=2031&cs=1 |title=John Caparulo (Stars in Vince Vaughn's 'Wild West Comedy Show') |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]].com |first=Variety |last=Staff |date=February 1, 2008|accessdate=March 17, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.metacafe.com/watch/1046083/john_caparulo_clip/ |title=John Caparulo Clip |work=[[Metacafe]].com |accessdate=March 17, 2009}} He hosted ''Mobile Home Disaster'' on [[Country Music Television|CMT]], and played the part of 'Brian' on the short-lived ABC sitcom ''[[Work It (TV series)|Work It]]''. He also has a comedy special that aired on Comedy Central on December 21, 2008 called ''John Caparulo: Meet Cap'' which was directed by Dave Higby. The special was released on [[Compact Disc|CD]] on February 10, 2009 and on [[DVD]] on April 14, 2009.{{cite web |url=http://www.tower.com/meet-cap-john-caparulo-cd/wapi/113109204 |title=Meet Cap (CD) By: John Caparulo (Artist) |work=Tower.com |accessdate=March 17, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.walmart.com/catalog/product.do?product_id=10973697 |title=DVD: John Caparulo: Meet Cap (Full Frame) |work=[[Wal-mart]].com |accessdate=March 17, 2009}} Caparulo intermittently hosts ''The Mad Cap Hour'' radio show with his wife Jamie Caparulo and comedian Mark Ellis on Sirius XM, toadhopnetwork.com, and iTunes. In addition to touring, he regularly appears on the [[E!]] show ''[[Chelsea Lately]]'', and voices the character Headphone Joe on Disney's ''[[Fish Hooks]]''. Caparulo released his second album titled ''Come Inside Me'' in August, 2013 on Netflix.{{citation needed|date=December 2015}} In February 2014, Cap began releasing Caplets, a brand-new set of comedy every 30 days that he shoots at the Comedy and Magic Club in Hermosa Beach, California and distributes them on his website for free. ==Personal life== On the November 4th, 2010 episode of ''[[Chelsea Lately]]'', John announced that he proposed to Jamie Marie Kelly after his October 29 performance at the [[Comedy & Magic Club]] in [[Hermosa Beach, California]]. John and Jamie were wed at Water Street Tavern near their alma mater, Kent State University, on May 27, 2012. The couple currently resides in Calabasas, California and Las Vegas, Nevada with their three dogs, a [[basset hound]], a [[puggle]], and a rescued collie mix. On their October 26, 2014 #26 Domestic Disputes podcast Jamie reveals to John that they are having a child. On November 27, 2014 #28 of their podcast they reveal that their child is going to be a girl and that they are going to name her Madden Jae. They welcomed Madden Jae on May 22, 2015. ==Discography== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Top Comedy Albums|US Comedy]] ! width="45"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]] |- ! scope="row"| ''John Caparulo: Meet Cap'' | * Release date: February 10, 2009 * Label: [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros. Nashville]] | 8 | — |- ! scope="row"| ''Come Inside Me'' | * Release date: September 17, 2013 * Label: Warner Bros.
